mechanism.description: Sensory receptors on the legs and Haller's organ on the first pair of legs

evidence.title: Tick Sensory Systems
evidence.author: N. H. C. Barros-Battesti
evidence.citation: Barros-Battesti, N. H. C. (2020). Tick Sensory Systems. Insects, 11(4), 249.
evidence.note: Chemoreception is generally present in ticks; Haller's organ is the main olfactory sensor.

mechanism.description: Haller's organ on the first pair of legs

evidence.title: Tick Sensory Systems
evidence.author: N. H. C. Barros-Battesti
evidence.citation: Barros-Battesti, N. H. C. (2020). Tick Sensory Systems. Insects, 11(4), 249.
evidence.note: Thermoreception is generally present in ticks; Haller's organ is the main thermal sensor.

mechanism.description: Sensory hairs (setae) on the legs and body

evidence.title: Tick Sensory Systems
evidence.author: N. H. C. Barros-Battesti
evidence.citation: Barros-Battesti, N. H. C. (2020). Tick Sensory Systems. Insects, 11(4), 249.
evidence.note: Mechanoreception is generally present in ticks; Sensory hairs are used to detect vibrations
